sources.title: It's Love Again (1936) Directed by Victor Saville - She Fakes Fame - But Falls for Real!
sources.description:
Under pressure to come up with a story, gossip columnist Peter Carlton (Robert Young) invents the imaginary socialite and big game hunter "Mrs. Smythe-Smythe." This glamorous lady spends her time hunting tigers, jumping out of airplanes and driving men wild with her beauty. Carlton is somewhat taken aback when the real lady turns up in person, impersonated by aspiring actress Elaine Bradford (Jessie Matthews), in search of her big break.

Alternative title: Modern Masquerade (1936)
Colorized version: https://youtu.be/U3ryYGWDNZY


Director: Victor Saville
Writers: Marion Dix, Austin Melford, Lesser Samuels
Stars: Jessie Matthews, Robert Young, Sonnie Hale
Genres: Comedy, Musical


https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=UUMOycDFnpMeWzaITQSD1dWsOA

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: Elaine Bradford is a young singer and dancer, looking for her big break. Peter Carlton is a gossip columnist facing a deadline and a blank page. So, Peter invents "Mrs. Smythe-Smythe", a mysterious Englishwoman who spends her days hunting tigers in India, jumping out of airplanes, and generally driving men mad with her beauty. Since no one in London has ever seen Mrs. Smythe-Smythe, Elaine decides to impersonate the lady, in hopes that the publicity will land her the big break she's been looking for.
metadata.Writer: Marion Dix, Austin Melford, Lesser Samuels
metadata.Actors: Jessie Matthews, Robert Young, Sonnie Hale
